description: Amazon Linux 2 CIS Benchmark v3.0.0 - Section 1.1.2.4 Configure /var

controls.title: Ensure separate partition exists for /var
controls.description: The /var directory is used by daemons and other system services to store frequently changing data. Separating /var from the root filesystem ensures that processes cannot exhaust all available space on the root filesystem.
controls.remediation: Create a separate partition for /var and add it to /etc/fstab

controls.title: Ensure nodev option set on /var partition
controls.description: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices. This prevents device files from being created in /var.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nodev to the mount options for /var

controls.title: Ensure nosuid option set on /var partition
controls.description: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files. This prevents setuid files from being executed from /var.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nosuid to the mount options for /var
